p: Capitiú ( Siparuna guianensis) belongs to the Siparunaceae Family. It is a shrub about three meters high, the immature fruits were greenish, and the ripe ones were greenish and purplish, with short pedunculated axillary racemes, and opposite, elliptic, and lanceolate leaves. This plant releases a characteristic odour of fish. Leaf samples were identified and deposited in the medicinal plants herbarium of the Museu Paraense Emílio Goeldi.
